head.title: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Newark: Harbor Ferry Plan Advances

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Newark: Harbor Ferry Plan Advances

body.head.byline: By Andrew Jacobs (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: Plans for New York Harbor ferry loop move closer to reality with $300,000 in city financing for series of ferry stops in Brooklyn (S)

block.p: Plans for a New York Harbor ferry loop moved one step closer to reality last week with $300,000 in city financing for a series of ferry stops in Brooklyn. The money, which was included in the city's new budget approved last week, will pay for the design of docking facilities in Red Hook, Bay Ridge and at Fulton Ferry Landing. Ultimately, the $18.5 million loop is to include 25 stops in New Jersey, Staten Island, Manhattan and Brooklyn, with boats running clockwise and counterclockwise around the harbor every 15 to 20 minutes.

Plans for a New York Harbor ferry loop moved one step closer to reality last week with $300,000 in city financing for a series of ferry stops in Brooklyn. The money, which was included in the city's new budget approved last week, will pay for the design of docking facilities in Red Hook, Bay Ridge and at Fulton Ferry Landing. Ultimately, the $18.5 million loop is to include 25 stops in New Jersey, Staten Island, Manhattan and Brooklyn, with boats running clockwise and counterclockwise around the harbor every 15 to 20 minutes.
